update.description:
This code refactor reduces the number of arguments used in multiple internal methods by creating a new `Publisher` class. This class stores information about a topic and its publisher.

The `Publisher_TEST` class will be available in a different pull request.

CI results:

* [Drone](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/396) is happy.
* [Jenkins Ubuntu Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-trusty-amd64/23/) is happy.
* [Jenkins Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/48/) is happy.
* [Jenkins Windows7-AMD64](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-amd64/31/) is happy (the code just compiles, tests don't run on Windows yet).
* [Jenkins Windows7-i386](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ignition_transport/job/ignition_transport-any-devel-windows7-i386/125/) is happy (the code just compiles, tests don't run on Windows yet).
update.title: Publisher class

content.html: I am going to merge this pull request soon unless someone has comments/suggestions/problems.

content.raw:
You can reduce the scope of Publisher using:

`this->SendMsg(ByeType, Publisher("", "", this->dataPtr->pUuid, "", Scope_t::All));`

Since we are using C++11, we can get use:

`this->SendMsg(ByeType, {"", "", this->dataPtr->pUuid, "", Scope_t::All});`
content.html:
You can reduce the scope of Publisher using:

this->SendMsg(ByeType, Publisher("", "", this->dataPtr->pUuid, "", Scope_t::All));

Since we are using C++11, we can get use:

this->SendMsg(ByeType, {"", "", this->dataPtr->pUuid, "", Scope_t::All});

content.raw: It's also not critical. You can keep this the way it is, and change all templates at some later date.
content.html: It's also not critical. You can keep this the way it is, and change all templates at some later date.

content.raw: I agree with Jose. Moving implementation outside of the class will be cleaner.
content.html: I agree with Jose. Moving implementation outside of the class will be cleaner.

content.raw: Remove the "Set" prefix here, and anywhere else in this PR.
content.html: Remove the "Set" prefix here, and anywhere else in this PR.

content.html: Since you're changing the API here, could you also remove the "Get" prefix? There are a few places in this pull request.

content.raw: modern compilers could decide to ignore or even mark a method as inline depending on situations, so the inline mechanism is relatively controlled by the user.
content.html: modern compilers could decide to ignore or even mark a method as inline depending on situations, so the inline mechanism is relatively controlled by the user.

content.raw:
Interesting topic. I think we should keep it as it is for consistency with the rest of the templated header files but consider it for the future. The only disadvantage that I see is that we miss the opportunity to let the compiler decide if the function is inlined or not (although our templated functions are not trivial).

Otherwise, the header file might look cleaner.
content.html:
Interesting topic. I think we should keep it as it is for consistency with the rest of the templated header files but consider it for the future. The only disadvantage that I see is that we miss the opportunity to let the compiler decide if the function is inlined or not (although our templated functions are not trivial).

Otherwise, the header file might look cleaner.

content.raw:
I don't know if we have a policy for placing templated method definitions but we could put it outside of the body class declaration (just after it). How it is now we are implicitly asking the compiler to inline it (by including the definition together with the declaration inside the class body) which given the method size probably is not going to happen anyway.

I've made the change in the branch `publisher_class_jrivero`, just in case that you want to consider it.
content.html:
I don't know if we have a policy for placing templated method definitions but we could put it outside of the body class declaration (just after it). How it is now we are implicitly asking the compiler to inline it (by including the definition together with the declaration inside the class body) which given the method size probably is not going to happen anyway.

I've made the change in the branch publisher_class_jrivero, just in case that you want to consider it.

content.html: It looks good upon my initial inspection of the code and tests, apart from some minor comments. I'm going to run a quick test using handsim and communication between multiple computers.
